page.title: 02BACUP AND STACKSTEADS
page.content: The cotton mills which have not been converted for use in the shoe industry have been either sub-divided into small industrial lots (largely for light engineering purposes) or have been demolished. With the recent nearby links to the motorway network the area is becoming increasingly popular as a 'commuter belt' for Manchester (25 miles away), and there are many small private housing estates being developed to accommodate this. Commuters are attracted to the area by low house prices, low rates, pleasant semi-rural surroundings and good recreational facilities. Away from the ribbon development along the valleys, the uplands are typical Pennine moorland with small hill farms specialising in sheep and small dairy herds.
